title: Prohibits use of lottery funds for any purpose other than education and prohibits co-mingling with funds for other purposes
summary: Prohibits use of lottery funds for any purpose other than education and prohibits co-mingling with funds for other purposes.

       AN ACT to amend the tax law and the state finance law,  in  relation  to
         prohibiting the use of lottery funds for any purpose other than educa-
         tion

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 1612 of the tax law is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  subdivision h to read as follows:
    3    H.  NO  REVENUES  COLLECTED PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE SHALL BE USED FOR
    4  ANY PURPOSE OTHER THAN PROVIDING AID TO ALL SCHOOL  CHILDREN  AND  SHALL
    5  NOT BE CO-MINGLED WITH FUNDS DESIGNATED FOR ANY OTHER PURPOSE.
    6    S  2.  Subdivision  3  of  section  92-c  of the state finance law, as
    7  amended by chapter 913 of the laws  of  1977,  is  amended  to  read  as
    8  follows:
    9    3.  The  moneys in such fund shall be appropriated or transferred only
   10  (i) for repayment of first instance expenditures incurred in the  opera-
   11  tion of the state lottery, PROVIDED HOWEVER, THAT NO MONEYS IN SUCH FUND
   12  SHALL  BE APPROPRIATED OR TRANSFERRED FOR ANY PURPOSE OTHER THAN PROVID-
   13  ING AID TO ALL SCHOOL CHILDREN AND SHALL NOT BE  CO-MINGLED  WITH  FUNDS
   14  DESIGNATED  FOR  ANY  OTHER  PURPOSE,  (ii)  for  the  state fiscal year
   15  commencing April  first,  nineteen  hundred  seventy-six  only  for  the
   16  purpose  of  providing  aid  to pupils with special educational needs as
   17  defined in paragraph e of subdivision one of section thirty-six  hundred
   18  two  of  the  education  law,  and  pupils  with handicapping conditions
   19  receiving state financial support for programs delineated in paragraph f
   20  of subdivision one of section thirty-six hundred  two,  article  eighty-
   21  three,  article eighty-five, article eighty-seven, article eighty-eight,
   22  article eighty-nine, AND article forty  [and  subdivision  seventeen  of

    1  section  thirty-six hundred two] of the education law, and for any state
    2  fiscal year commencing after such nineteen  hundred  seventy-six  fiscal
    3  year for the purpose of providing aid to all school children pursuant to
    4  the provisions of subdivision four of this section, (iii) for elementary
    5  and  secondary  education,  (iv)  for expenditures for machines or other
    6  capital equipment which the division of the  lottery  is  authorized  to
    7  purchase  for  the  operation  of the lottery and (v) for payment in the
    8  state fiscal years commencing April first, nineteen hundred seventy-sev-
    9  en, nineteen hundred seventy-eight  and  nineteen  hundred  seventy-nine
   10  into  the winter sports education trust fund, as created in section four
   11  hundred ninety-five-a of article ten-C of the  education  law,  for  the
   12  purposes  of  such fund in accordance with the provisions of subdivision
   13  five of this section. Payments into such trust fund shall discontinue at
   14  such time as the sum of one hundred million dollars, in  the  aggregate,
   15  has  been  paid  into  such  fund  or  upon March thirty-first, nineteen
   16  hundred eighty, whichever  event  occurs  first.  Nothing  herein  shall
   17  prohibit  the purchase of machines or other capital equipment from funds
   18  appropriated for expenditures  under  paragraph  (i)  [hereof]  OF  THIS
   19  SUBDIVISION.
   20    S  3.  This  act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
   21  have become a law and shall apply to revenues collected as a  result  of
   22  the  New  York  state  lottery  for education occurring on or after such
   23  date.
